thesis.description: Experiments were performed to assess the role of extravascular compression (EVC) in the regulation of coronary blood flow (CBF). The steady state study demonstrated an overall decrease in total coronary vascular resistance (CVR) with increasing heart rates. Total CV was fractioned into several components. The decrease in CV was found to be accomplished mainly by a fall in PA at constant flow.
thesis.creator: Paltoo, Raymond M.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: Physical factors in the regulation of coronary blood flow
